H0.text: A pie chart best describes how the student arranged the information, recording daily ant counts at the same time with dates in one column and the number of ants counted on each date in a second column.

H1.text: A data table is how the student arranged the information, with the date of observation in one column and the number of ants counted in a second column.

H2.text: Bar graph is the best way to describe how the student arranged the information, with the date of observation written in one column and the number of ants counted on each date written in a second column.

H3.text: Scatterplot is the best description of how the student arranged the information, with dates of observation in one column and the number of ants counted in a second column.

A4.text: A table consists of an ordered arrangement of rows and columns.
